channel.title: Holding both registration and login in a single form?
channel.description:
Hi guys. I've toyed with a little idea I had about storing both the login and registration form in the same form. The idea is like this: The form loads and displays the login form, with a joint login and register button below it. The login button is larger than the register button. If the user presses login here, it will log them in. If the user presses the register button, new inputs fade in (the inputs needed for registration) and the register button expends whilst the login button shrinks. Clicking register here will register the user, clicking login will reopen the login screen.
The forms will be loaded safely with HTML and then replaced via JS with dynamic forms so that users with JS disabled can use them properly.
Here are some examples:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/iDXFVgS.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/BRFWAfj.png[/img]
Please give me feedback!

item.title: Holding both registration and login in a single form?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:3, topic:547643”]kinda bulky for

storing both the login and registration form in the same form.

[uuuu] [pppp]
[ssssssssssss]

*u = username input field
*p = password input field
*s = submit button

sql: user lookup ->
if user found -> check password -> if correct login / if invalid, display alert
if user not found -> add another field to the form / change the form to a ‘confirm password’ field’ etc -> register if entered correctly twice.

functionality is a lot better than the way you have it.

if you dont/can’t do the above, at least use some form of tabbed layout for register/login as registering generally consists of more fields.
if it’s the same amount of fields / do it via code - not multiple buttons. (imo is ugly)[/quote]

My only problem with that system is that a “submit” button doesn’t give the user any idea of what they’re actually doing. I think I’ll use a login form on the homepage with a button underneath to switch it to a registration page.
